input_text:
Job Title: Senior Account Manager

Location: Newtown Square, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Internal Title: Senior Account ManagerDepartment: Account ManagementReports to: Director of Account ManagementFLSA Status: ExemptEmployment Type: Regular, Full-Time
In the words of our President, we are “characters through and through” and that is what sets us apart. We value collaboration, teamwork, inclusivity, and diversity. We believe in superior service, tailored solutions, and a culture of caring. A successful Sr. Account Manager will maintain this mindset and integrate these values into their work. Our standards are high, and we hope yours are, too!
The right person for this position will enjoy partnering with others and knows that strong relationships and open communication yield great results. It is a must for this person to have an eye for detail, be proactive, flexible, organized, and value an extremely high level of service.
The Sr. Account Manager serves as the primary point of contact for a block of accounts that includes small to large, multi-state, multi-site clients held by a senior member of our leadership team. This person will work closely with benefits consultants, internal service teams and other account managers to meet and exceed client expectations. 
The lines of coverage include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Spending Accounts, Group Life and AD&D insurance, disability, and voluntary benefits.
Job ResponsibilitiesWorks closely with Benefits Consultant to coordinate and negotiate renewal; communicates clients’ needs, issues, risks, and opportunities; prepares renewal for client presentations.Collaborates with Benefits Consultant on overall account strategy including the ways to identify up-sell/cross-sell opportunities; builds re-enrollment strategies for the clients.Develops employee communication and enrollment materials for client distribution.Responsible for oversight, monitoring and compliance with any performance guarantees on assigned cases.Understands, interprets, and clearly delivers financial and claims experience reporting and data to clients.Acts as escalation point for resolution of non-routine issues. Identifies root cause and communicates resolution to client.Understands client business, issues, and needs through proactive face-to-face (when appropriate) client visits and proactive phone contact; builds, maintains, and manages positive ongoing client relationships.Oversees client's benefits accounts, including but not limited to, new development, internal and external communication, support, and maintenance issues.Other projects, tasks or special assignments as requested.
Required Job Skills and Qualifications:3+ years of experience working in the group insurance industry with current Life and Health Insurance LicenseKnowledge of Medical, Dental and Vision insurance products, plan designs, contracts, and services.Thorough knowledge of financing methodologies and strategies (fully insured, alternate funded)Experience consulting with clients including negotiation, persuasion and influencing; ability to influence others without specific authority.Ability to build and maintain collaborative working relationships at all levels internally and externally.Values a high level of customer service with the ability to balance client satisfaction and the needs of the business.Strong facilitation and presentation skillsNaturally a proactive thinker, communicator, and plannerPossesses financial aptitude/analytical skills.Technical aptitude to work within carrier portals, help lead HRIS/HCM builds, maintain and navigate databases, and manipulate spreadsheets with large data sets.Ability to maintain composure and effectiveness under pressure in a deadline driven industry.Goal oriented; meet persistency goals, renewal goals, etc.Computer proficiency in MS Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPointRepresent Creative Benefits, Inc. in a professional manner
Preferred Skills and Qualifications:Has knowledge of the Ancillary insurance products including Group Life and AD&D insurance, disability and voluntary benefitsPrevious experience working with large, multi-state, multi-site clients.Bachelor's degree preferred.Experience working with HRIS systems or Payroll systems.Experience analyzing claims and financial data sets.Experience managing a team directly or indirectly leading others.
Supervisory ResponsibilityThis position does not have any direct reports but could possibly require the training and mentoring of more junior team members.
Work EnvironmentThis job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers, phones and photocopiers.
Physical DemandsWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary. Must be able to lift 25 pounds.
Position Type/Expected Hours of WorkThis is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.
TravelTravel is occasional and primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected.
Creative Benefits, Inc. is an employee benefits consulting and brokerage firm with offices in Newtown Square and Kingston, Pennsylvania. We support small, mid-sized and large employers in the tri-state area and across the country in a variety of industries. It is our mission to create optimal solutions in employee benefits that 'insures' the right coverage for every stage of life.
Base pay is anticipated to start at $65,000. Compensation may vary based on a variety of factors such as, but not limited to, individual skills, experience, training and education/certifications.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Senior Account Manager
output_json.summary: A Senior Account Manager position at Creative Benefits, Inc.

Identifies root cause and communicates resolution to client
Understands client business, issues, and needs
Proactive face-to-face and phone contact with clients
Builds, maintains, and manages positive ongoing client relationships
New development, internal and external communication
Other projects, tasks, or special assignments

Occasional local travel, some out-of-area and overnight travel expected.
